Title: b'Product Support Operations Manager'
column5:
b'
At Netflix, we are shaping the future of global entertainment because we believe there is a better way to watch. Our members need our help from time to time, and that\xe2\x80\x99s where our Global Customer Service (CS) organization focuses; providing amazing interactions with our subscribers around the world. Our goal is excellence, simplicity and getting our members back to streaming. Netflix is looking for a talented Product Support Operations Manager to join our Product Support Operations (PSO) team.


The Product Support Operations team is the bridge between Netflix CS teams and our partners in Product, Marketing, and other business functions, focusing on agent/operational readiness, customer self-service, facilitating insights, and driving improvements to the customer and agent experience. Product Support Operations Managers (PSOMs) are aligned by functional areas and are deep subject matter experts, advocates for the customer/agent experience, data-savvy influencers, and great communicators.


Responsibilities


  • Provide key customer insights and feedback to the Product teams and other internal and external business partners and inform consumer product development with a clear understanding of how people use and feel about our product and what is driving customer service contacts, and advocating for a better user experience.
  • Responsible for operational readiness and effective communication of product features and changes to customer service agents through internal Knowledge Base content and other communication channels.
  • Responsible for creation and updates of relevant Help Center content (help.netflix.com) and self-service tooling to ensure customers who seek help will find resolution to the most frequently asked questions
  • Leveraging multiple data sources to provide data-driven analysis and recommendations.


Qualifications


  • 4+ years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in one or more of the following areas: Program Management, Product Management, Project Management, Product Marketing or Customer Support.
  • Experience in gathering business insights and identifying trends from data, including a combination of data from multiple sources.
  • Excellent writing and communication skills.
  • Strong user experience focus and experience, preferably with consumer web or related products.
  • Experience in working with global teams across different time zones.
  • Familiarity with customer service environment a huge plus.
  • Desired qualities: Innovative thinking, curious, action oriented, ability to drive improvements, strong relationship builder, excellent analytical and problem solving skills, superior communication skills, highly adaptable, and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
'

Title: b'Worldwide Supply Demand Product Planner'
column5:
b'

Summary
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.


The people here at Apple don\xe2\x80\x99t just create products \xe2\x80\x94 they create the kind of wonder that\xe2\x80\x99s revolutionized entire industries. It\xe2\x80\x99s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it.


Apple is looking for dynamic, highly motivated Supply Demand Planners for our World- Wide Operations group. World-Class operational excellence is a cornerstone of Apple's ability to consistently surprise and delight our customers. The WW Supply Demand Planner plays a critical role in ensuring operational and financial success for the organization. You will be a member of the Supply Demand Management team, a highly influential group within Apple, challenged to scale at the pace of the company\xe2\x80\x99s overall growth.


The Supply Demand Planner will develop, communicate, and execute end-to- end product demand and supply plans across all channels of distribution in over 80 countries for a current or future product line. Product line assignments will be made at the time of hire in any of Apple\xe2\x80\x99s multi-billion dollar businesses, including Mac, Watch, iPad, iPhone and Accessories.


Key Qualifications
You combine exceptional analytical capabilities, business savvy and leadership skills.

You are able to exert tactful influence in a matrixed organization, be a strong team

player and communicator.

You should be comfortable presenting to executive management.


Description
Forecast demand, inventory, and multi-channel sell through. Generate weekly and quarterly supply plans that meet Apple\xe2\x80\x99s financial objectives. Evaluate risks. Plan and implement contingency plans to mitigate.

Analyze product sales on a daily basis. Find opportunities and drive partner groups to appropriate action.

Coordinate closely with regional product planning teams to ensure supply plans meet sales requirements. Coordinate with Marketing and New Product Operations teams to set launch quantities of new product introductions and to ensure smooth product transitions.

Partner with the global procurement teams to allocate constrained components, ensure raw material inventory targets are met, and minimize material obsolescence during product transition.

Present product updates and recommended actions to Operations executive management team on a weekly basis.

Identify improvement opportunities in the product planning process, marshal resources, and drive projects to completion.

The role is Cupertino-based with less than 10% required travel.


Education & Experience
MBA, Masters Degree in a related field, or equivalent work experience, is desired.

Prior experience in fields that demand complex quantitative analysis such as finance or consulting is desired. Prior experience in product planning, production control, inventory management, or production/manufacturing operations is a plus.


Additional Requirements
Ability to think strategically and execute tactically, a persistent attention to detail, and a high level of comfort in working with numbers.

Title: b'Global Supply Manager'
column5:
b'

Summary
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Apple is seeking a Global Sourcing & Supply Manager (GSSM) to assist with Silicon Strategic Planning, long-term deal structuring and negotiations. This position requires working with procurement, engineering, finance and legal teams and also third-parties such as semiconductor foundries and suppliers. This position requires strong quantitative and analytical skills, critical thinking, and ability to balance multiple projects simultaneously.


Key Qualifications
The Global Sourcing & Supply Manager is positioned at the interface between Apple\xe2\x80\x99s product teams and the industries that supply core component technologies. We are responsible for developing and carrying out sourcing strategies as well as recommending product innovations based on improving technology. The position requires an interest in market dynamics, pricing, manufacturing processes, and risk mitigation. The team drives centralized capacity planning for all semiconductor components used across Apple products and helps drive long term strategic deals.


Description
The role is complex and often has to wear multiple hats: focusing on big picture roadmap one moment and the minute details the next. Here are some highlights of the role:

- Develop a multifaceted understanding of the semiconductor commodity landscape to forecast industry trends and gauge emerging forces. Identify changes in buyer and supplier power and use industry dynamics to Apple\xe2\x80\x99s advantage.

- Perform supplier financial research, spend analysis and ad-hoc financial analysis for strategic procurement deals

- Work with suppliers to negotiate optimal terms for sourcing. Understand the trade-offs between cost, volume, and quality in order to strike agreements that meet Apple\xe2\x80\x99s performance criteria and secure long-term supply continuity.

- Collaborate across the Apple organization to ensure business objectives are met. Includes rapidly synthesizing and presenting findings to senior leaders and to actively identify potential supply issues that can affect product strategy.

- Optimize silicon supply chain performance through cost and capacity scenario analysis, and benchmarking. Develop an in-depth understanding of valued manufacturing processes and costs and market intelligence, and apply this knowledge to influence Apple\xe2\x80\x99s future product roadmap and sourcing decisions.

- Provide overall program management support and supply to ongoing development of processes, templates, issue procedures, and reporting


Education & Experience
BA/BS degree plus 3 to 5 years of work experience, masters degree or MBA is a plus


Additional Requirements
Experience in semiconductor supply chain operations or semiconductor equity research is desired

Direct experience in long-term silicon capacity planning, a plus

Strong analytical and critical thinking

Ability to develop sound internal and external working relationships

An interest in negotiations

Ability to make quick decisions with 80% information

Thirst for knowledge and the ability to learn quickly

Willingness to travel internationally (20% - 30%)

Title: b'Product Manager (Remote)'
column5:
b'
Company Description


Tidepool is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization on a mission to make diabetes data more accessible, actionable, and meaningful for people with diabetes, their care teams, and researchers. Founded in 2013, Tidepool hosts a suite of free software tools for people with diabetes and the clinics that serve them, including Tidepool Web, Tidepool Mobile, Tidepool Uploader, and, pending submission to FDA and associated review, Tidepool Loop. Learn more at tidepool.org.


Job Description


As a Product Manager at Tidepool, you will help drive the strategy, roadmap, and execution of our user and clinician-facing products. This position reports to the VP of Product and User Experience.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:


  • Define product strategy for your product(s), leveraging deep understanding of the pain points of people living with diabetes and healthcare providers, their desired gains, market trends and competitive landscape.
  • Drive development of a roadmap and business plan for your product(s).
  • Lead the discovery, ideation, scoping, execution, launch and growth of user centric features to address pain points and business opportunities. Drive product development through its end-to-end lifecycle.
  • Develop hypotheses, experiments, and research plans with the product design team.
  • Conduct user research alongside the product design team to capture and represent user and healthcare provider needs and the way they interact with your product(s). Use insights to inform product decisions, deliver on user needs and drive meaningful outcomes for the business.
  • Build out adoption / onboarding / upgrade features, ensure value is clear across the ecosystem of product(s) and that the right monetization levers are in place.
  • Synthesize data, user insights, and market insights to identify significant opportunities to improve user engagement, retention, and revenue for your product(s).
  • Manage complex schedules that involve both internal and external teams, across hardware and software. Serve as the external and internal point of contact for key partners.
  • Collaborate with business development, sales, marketing and fundraising to create go-to-market plans and materials to communicate, position, and promote the value proposition of your product(s) you are releasing.
  • Work with marketing to build a commercialization and distribution plan for your product(s).
  • Provide regular updates on new features and capabilities to stakeholders and build consensus around roadmaps and success metrics.
  • Drive product excellence through collaboration and communication. Partner closely with product design, research, software engineering, quality engineering, marketing, business development, sales, clinical, regulatory and technical support.
  • Establish product and feature priorities. Provide regular updates on new features and capabilities to stakeholders and build consensus around roadmaps and success metrics.
  • Use Tidepool\xe2\x80\x99s task management system, Jira, to document product requirements and track development progress.
  • Work with marketing to build a commercialization and distribution plan for your product(s).
  • Define key performance metrics for product(s) or feature(s) and closely analyze product performance to measure success, identify gaps and areas of improvement. Report back to the team about performance and improvement opportunities.
  • Collaborate with Tidepool\xe2\x80\x99s Human Factors and design team to plan, analyze and report on findings.
Qualifications


  • Entrepreneurial mindset who searches for ways to improve the product and user experience.
  • Experience driving adoption across multiple large product initiatives.
  • Is metrics minded and thinks about how your product team\xe2\x80\x99s work ladders up to business and user value.
  • Can take rough themes and turn them into a roadmap of features, experiments, and research with minimal guidance.
  • 5+ years of experience as a product manager on growth or new product development, or equivalent experience in user research, product design or engineering.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with aptitude for clearly articulating customer needs.
  • High user empathy with a strong focus on execution and being able to put ideas into action.
  • Proven ability to take a product from conception to successful market adoption
  • Experience developing software, e.g. iOS and/or Android mobile applications, and Web applications in an agile environment.
  • Healthcare, wellness, medical device experience, especially diabetes device or application experience is a nice to have.
  • Experience with human factors analysis and reporting is a nice to have.


Additional Information


Salary range: The salary range for this position is $95,100 to $143,900. To learn more about Tidepool's compensation philosophy please visit Tidepool's Employee Handbook.


Benefits include:


  • Flexible PTO
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage
  • Health and Childcare FSA
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Wellness and Productivity stipend
  • Continuing Education Reimbursement
  • Other


Other Information:


While many of Tidepool\xe2\x80\x99s team members have a personal connection to diabetes, this is not a requirement. We do ask that you have empathy for chronic conditions and you are prepared to learn about the diabetes experience.


This is a remote position. You\xe2\x80\x99ll be working from home and interacting with a team of colleagues that works around the world. Learn more about working at Tidepool, including our approach to inclusion and diversity in this blog post.

Title: b'Director of Product Management, Trucking'
column5:
b'
Waymo is an autonomous driving technology company with a mission to make it safe and easy for people and things to get where they\xe2\x80\x99re going. Since our start as the Google Self-Driving Car Project in 2009, Waymo has been focused on building the Waymo Driver\xe2\x80\x94The World\xe2\x80\x99s Most Experienced Driver\xe2\x84\xa2\xe2\x80\x94to improve everyone's access to mobility while saving thousands of lives now lost to traffic crashes. Our Waymo Driver powers Waymo One, our fully autonomous ride-hailing service, as well as Waymo Via, our trucking and local delivery service. To date, Waymo has driven over 20 million miles autonomously on public roads across 25 U.S. cities and conducted over 20 billion miles of simulation testing.

Waymo takes an integrated approach to building the world\xe2\x80\x99s first fully autonomous driving technology, with researchers, designers, product managers, and technical program managers working side by side. We seek to understand the needs of our users and the opportunities of the technology to ensure we build the best product. From autonomous driving behavior to user interfaces, we work to inspire the product vision and then make it a reality.

In This Role, You'll
  • Lead a group of product managers in defining the Trucking roadmap for Waymo, combining deep technical expertise, business and market understanding, strategic thinking and organizational leadership
  • Work closely with Engineering to turn breakthrough technologies into product capabilities
  • Work cross-functionally with Operations, Marketing, Supply Chain, Policy, Legal, and other Waymo teams to bring to market products that solve customer needs, save lives, and transform freight transportation
  • Analyze data from real-world miles collected by our fleet, define Trucking requirements and help the team make the right trade-offs between capability, cost, engineering complexity and other factors
  • Help to refine Waymo's product vision and strategy
At a Minimum We'd Like You To Have
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, a related technical field or equivalent practical experience
  • 10+ years of product management experience
  • Experience in leading extremely technical products from inception to large scale user adoption
  • Experience in managing product managers while still being hands-on
  • Exceptional skills in prioritizing and building alignment around those priorities
  • B2B experience
It's Preferred If You Have
  • Trucking, transportation or logistics experience
  • Experience as a founder or have worked in an early stage startup

Logistics -


  • On-a-Dash - From the time the Dasher accepts the order to the time it's delivered, help Dashers be as efficient as possible. Dashers should never wait at the store and drop-offs at the consumer should be seamless regardless of if you're delivering to a single family home or 20 story apartment complex.
  • Fleet Excellence - Ensure that DoorDash has the highest quality gig fleet on the planet. Consumers should choose DoorDash because our Dasher's go above and beyond and always take care of the customer. Do this in a way where Dashers feel rewarded for delivering at high quality.
  • Dashforce - Create new earnings opportunities for Dashers by enabling them to do more than one type of job. Enable Merchants to lever a massive pool of flexible labor for tasks like shopping or filling prescriptions. Dashers that choose to should have no problem working DoorDash as a primary source of income.
  • Consumer Demand Shaping - Operate at the intersection of new ordering use cases for Consumers AND driving more batches. For example, giving Consumers the opportunity to pre-schedule meals that have planned routes that set the standard of Driver efficiency. Then do that again.
  • Dispatch - Enable the fastest and most efficient assignments. No matter what we're delivering -- could be paper towels, groceries and hot food in the same car DoorDash should be making the best assignment decision for Consumers, Merchants, Dashers and DoorDash.
  • Merchant Logistics - Be the merchant's "Chief Operating Officer in a Box" who handles the nitty gritty of running an efficient, profitable, and defect free operation so that they can focus on creating amazing food. Your success will be measured by merchant defects like missing/incorrect items, dasher wait and whether we are the merchant's operating partner of choice.
  • Supply and Demand - You are ensuring the balance of the marketplace. Every order should have an available Dasher but at the same time every Dasher should be getting orders non-stop. We should be as cost efficient as possible in enabling this balance, getting the perfect amount of Dashers to the right place at the right time.

From labor laws, to how merchants operate to whether deliveries are done on bikes vs. cars our logistics strategy and roadmap needs to change to deliver quality and efficiency in that market. As the intl logistics lead you will ensure that logistics in every country is built to win that country.

Title: b'Product Manager, Games - External Development'
column5:
b'

The Live Service Product Manager is primarily responsible for our live service games; they will analyze and report on game & event performance, from high-level KPIs to deep dives into specific strategies. They will utilize game data, competitive research, and player feedback to formulate new engagement strategies. They will support our developers in crafting daily, weekly, monthly content programs to ensure the highest performance of their game. Additionally they will work with producers and designers to prioritize content that improves retention and provides members with a great gaming experience. PM\xe2\x80\x99s will also work across Completable and Repeatable games to ensure the portfolio as a whole is healthy and driving the correct outcome for the business.
Responsibilities
  • Own Live Service optimization efforts at the title level
  • Use deep knowledge of the mobile market and free to play space to ensure we are approaching game optimization and features in the best way for high retention
  • Partner with Producers to provide product analysis to support Live Service decisions that optimize each game
  • Closely collaborate with external studio product & creative partners to ensure external games cater to players\xe2\x80\x99 motivations while maximizing acquisition and engagement drivers, and manage key features that further optimize efforts towards live service best practices
  • Determine the research strategy to ensure product decisions are data-driven and meet user needs, including the ability to qualitatively and quantitatively teardown games on any platform.
  • Drive experiments across live titles on new business models built on top of the subscription business model.
Required Qualifications
  • 5+ years of experience in the gaming industry, working in analytical roles including strategy & analysis and product management, assessing ongoing performance and optimization for games in multiple categories
  • Exceptional experience in game design for retention optimization. Deep understanding of economy and monetization design
  • Experience working with live service games on any platform (PC, console, mobile), supporting feature development and live service over several major feature deployments
  • Deep understanding of engagement drivers in live service games
  • Experience managing teams directly and managing cross functional groups through influence
  • Continuously looking for ways to improve and iterate on existing framework, or building anew for best results
  • Passion for video games, innovations in software and how they enrich the player experience

Title: b'Product Manager - Content Finance'
column5:
b'
Role location: Los Gatos, or Los Angeles, CA
It's an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment around the world. We have grown to over 204 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. We\xe2\x80\x99ve become the largest entertainment studio in the world, creating new original content at an incredible pace. The Studio Innovation product team is front and center of this growth. We build software that fuels the production of content at Netflix. Every year, Netflix spends billions (projected $17B in 2022) producing content to constantly delight members. We\xe2\x80\x99re looking for a Product Manager to join the Content Finance Innovation team as we build products to forecast and optimize this large content spend and manage content financials at Netflix.
As a Product Manager for our financial systems, you will be responsible for helping to build products to forecast and account for Netflix\xe2\x80\x99s content spend; working across a broad range of internal teams finance, studio, and product teams. You will partner with a cross functional team of designers, engineers, analysts, and other specialists to help execute on strategy to deliver products that drive impact and optimize the scale and complexity of our business. A successful candidate will have the creativity to look at problems in new ways, the boldness to try new things, a hypothesis-driven mentality, exceptional organizational influence, and will be equally as excited about 99.999% accuracy as you are about seamless user experiences.
At Netflix, our product team is small. You have the opportunity to make a big impact. Our unique culture drives our approach to innovation.
In This Role You Will
  • Work with Product Managers and cross-functional teams to help to plan the vision and execute on a roadmap for Content Financial Reporting, including critical aspects of accounting for content spend and payment generation, internal & management reporting and tracking forecasts to actuals
  • Partner with our Finance & Studio teams to dissect current workflows and leverage custom technology and off-the-shelf offerings to enable reporting for accurate actuals at scale
  • Foster a learn-fast mentality, collaborate with operational teams to roll out products to our employees and partners.
  • Own problems, not just technology
What We're Looking For
  • 2+ years of Product Management experience with a proven record of successfully launching products, features, or platforms.
  • Experience with building or implementing enterprise financial applications and a strong understanding of operational finance activities, such as budgeting and forecasting, cash planning, procurement, etc. is a plus.
  • Ability to prioritize well and mobilize execution teams and business partners towards a common goal.
  • Strong communication skills, in writing or verbally, whether in small group discussions, large-scale presentations, or with senior leaders.
  • Exceptional analytical skills.
  • A passion for product management
Does this sound interesting but overwhelming? Please don\xe2\x80\x99t self-select out; let\xe2\x80\x99s figure it out together. We\xe2\x80\x99d love to talk to you!
We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds more substantial teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

It's an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment around the world. We have grown to over 204 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. We build software that fuels the production of content at Netflix. Every year, Netflix spends billions (projected $17B in 2022) producing content to constantly delight members. We\xe2\x80\x99re looking for a Product Manager to join the Content Finance Innovation team as we build products to forecast and optimize this large content spend and manage content financials at Netflix.
As a Product Manager for our financial systems, you will be responsible for helping to build products to forecast and account for Netflix\xe2\x80\x99s content spend; working across a broad range of internal teams finance, studio, and product teams. You will partner with a cross functional team of designers, engineers, analysts, and other specialists to help execute on strategy to deliver products that drive impact and optimize the scale and complexity of our business. A successful candidate will have the creativity to look at problems in new ways, the boldness to try new things, a hypothesis-driven mentality, exceptional organizational influence, and will be equally as excited about 99.999% accuracy as you are about seamless user experiences.
At Netflix, our product team is small. You have the opportunity to make a big impact. Our unique culture drives our approach to innovation.
In This Role You Will
  • Work with Product Managers and cross-functional teams to help to plan the vision and execute on a roadmap for Content Financial Reporting, including critical aspects of accounting for content spend and payment generation, internal & management reporting and tracking forecasts to actuals
  • Partner with our Finance & Studio teams to dissect current workflows and leverage custom technology and off-the-shelf offerings to enable reporting for accurate actuals at scale
  • Foster a learn-fast mentality, collaborate with operational teams to roll out products to our employees and partners.
  • Own problems, not just technology

  • 2+ years of Product Management experience with a proven record of successfully launching products, features, or platforms.
  • Experience with building or implementing enterprise financial applications and a strong understanding of operational finance activities, such as budgeting and forecasting, cash planning, procurement, etc. is a plus.
  • Ability to prioritize well and mobilize execution teams and business partners towards a common goal.
  • Strong communication skills, in writing or verbally, whether in small group discussions, large-scale presentations, or with senior leaders.
  • Exceptional analytical skills.
  • A passion for product management

They use data to empower decision-makers with information, predictions, and insights that ultimately influence the experiences of millions of users worldwide. Scientists on the team build models, perform statistical analysis, and create visualizations to provide scalable, persistent capability that is iteratively improved through direct interaction with cross-functional business partners.


As a data scientist in the Core Data Science team, you will be partnering closely with the Analytics team, Finance, Business Operations, Commerce Product and Engineering teams to develop machine learning models and end-to-end data solutions for tackling a multitude of exciting challenges, including customer lifetime value modeling, signups and subscribers forecasting, fraud modeling, commerce optimization, and more.


We look for someone with analytical and modeling expertise, a proven track record of thought leadership and eagerness to drive impact.
